ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò la tɔ́g, fùɔ Zɛɛzɛ́sè tɔʼ ngǔʼ Hamaŋ gẅie aa míŋ Amendata nyìŋ Agag; à la kwéʼe yé ńtÿɔ́gɔ twómvfò na meŋwǎláʼ pé pie pâ pɔ̌ laa nkàŋ.
en: After all this took place, King Ahasuerus honored Haman, son of Hammedatha the Agagite.   He promoted him in rank and gave him a higher position than all the other officials.  # 3:1 Est 1:3,21; 2:18

ngiemboon: Pʉ̀a metsèm pie é lɔ́ɔn faʼa nɔʼ lɔ́ɔn ńtóo ńkẅíʼte mvfò yé, ńgÿo mekùʼ mé ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ fùɔ la záb, táʼ Mandoshÿe lʉʼʉ lékẅíʼte mvfò yé ńná mekùʼ mé.
en: The entire royal staff at the King’s Gate   bowed down and paid homage to Haman, because the king had commanded this to be done for him. But Mordecai would not bow down or pay homage.  # 3:2 Est 5:9

ngiemboon: Petsɔ́ pʉ̀a pie é lɔ́ɔn faʼa nɔʼ tó ńzɛ́te Mandoshÿe ngie: Mélàʼakɔ́ ɔ̀ tʉʉ twó na lepʉ̌ sie fùɔ zǎb?
en: The members of the royal staff at the King’s Gate asked Mordecai, “Why are you disobeying the king’s command? ”

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńzɛ́te yé púʼu pɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ ntsèm, tá á zɔɔn ńké te kwoŋo létyé tà ńzẅíʼte wɔ́. Páʼ Mandoshÿe la zɔɔn shwóŋo wɔ́b ngie aa nyìŋ Yúndà lá, pɔ́ leen ńké ńgʉa ḿbú ḿbíte shwóŋo Hamaŋ lélɔg ńgyá kà Mandoshÿe ge tiŋ ndʉʼ páʼ à ka zɔɔn ne ńtiŋe wɔ́ɔ.
en: When they had warned him day after day   and he still would not listen to them, they told Haman in order to see if Mordecai’s actions would be tolerated, since he had told them he was a Jew.

ngiemboon: Hamaŋ la gyá páʼ Mandoshÿe pǔ ńdʉʼʉ léŋwɔʼ nnɛ́ mvfò yé lélɔg ńgÿo mekùʼ mé, lóŋ we ffó.
en: When Haman saw that Mordecai was not bowing down or paying him homage, he was filled with rage.

ngiemboon: À la te kwoŋo lécúɔ pɔ́ ndàʼ Mandoshÿe gíle yé wɔ́, á nue mé ka shwóŋo yé lefǒo sé, Hamaŋ cʉ́ʼ ńtÿɔ́g pɔ́ páʼ à ge pú pyág pʉ̀a Yúndà, é mefɛ̌ Mandoshÿe pie é laa tsɛ̀ɛ láʼa fùɔ Zɛɛzɛ́sè.
en: And when he learned of Mordecai’s ethnic identity, it seemed repugnant to Haman to do away with   Mordecai alone. He planned to destroy all of Mordecai’s people, the Jews,  # 3:6 Est 6:10 throughout Ahasuerus’s kingdom.  # 3:6 Est 9:24; Ps 83:2–4

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ na ndùŋmvfò saŋ, á saŋ gẅie pʉ̀a Yúndà tóŋo lê Nisaŋ ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ na ngùʼu láʼ mbɔ́ɔntè ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a né legém gie Zɛɛzɛ́sè la néŋe na lʉŋ, mé tyé mvfò Hamaŋ ḿmaʼa tyèente gie mé tóŋo lê pûu, lélɔg faʼa lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ pɔ́ saŋ gẅie mé ge zẅé Mandoshÿe pâ pʉ̀a Yúndà, tà fóo na ndùŋmvfò saŋ ńgʉa ńkúu na saŋ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a, atyèente ŋwɛ́ gwe na saŋ gẅie pʉ̀a Yúndà tóŋ lê Andàa.
en: In the first month, the month of Nisan, in King Ahasuerus’s twelfth year,   the pur  #— #that is, the lot #— #was cast before Haman for each day in each month, and it fell on the twelfth month,  # 3:7 Est 9:24–28 the month Adar.  # 3:7 Ezr 6:15

ngiemboon: Hamaŋ gʉa ńgyá fùɔ Zɛɛzɛ́sè ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: Epʉ̀a tsɔ́ láʼ ée láʼ yɔɔn, ńgÿo mɔ́b menò pɔ́ na yɔb ntí, pɔ́ tsẅé pɔ́ jʉʼ ntsèm tsɛ̀ɛ meláʼ mie ɔ̀ sáʼa, pɔ́ té kúu nùɔ petsɔ́ pʉ̀a wɔ́, emɔ́b membʉ̌ kúbe na me petsɔ́ pʉ̀a; pɔ́ te tÿɔ́gɔ kwò na mbʉ̌ mie fùɔ zǎb wɔ́, á té poŋ ngie gù fùɔ nyé wɔ́b pɔ́ pʉ́le néŋe wɔ́.
en: Then Haman informed King Ahasuerus, “There is one ethnic group, scattered throughout the peoples in every province of your kingdom,   keeping themselves separate. Their laws are different from everyone else’s and they do not obey the king’s laws.  # 3:8 Jr 29:7; Ac 16:20–21 It is not in the king’s best interest to tolerate them.  # 3:8 Ezr 4:12–15

ngiemboon: Ankwɔbɔ́, ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńgyá á gwɔ́ mbòŋ, ɔ̀ ŋweʼe ŋwàʼne ńdɔg ńzáb ngie mé pyága wɔ́b, mbà mèŋ n ge tsẅi pangúmnɔ̀ɔn pie ée nɔʼ, pɔ́ fʉʼ nkáb tà á gie ngwɔ́ é gwɔ́ metónà nkÿo tá, ńná mé gʉa ńnéŋe tsɛ̀ɛ kʉbé nkáb nɔʼ.
en: If the king approves, let an order be drawn up authorizing their destruction, and I will pay 375 tons of silver to   the officials for deposit in the royal treasury.”  # 3:9 Est 4:7

ngiemboon: Fùɔ leen sẅɛɛ kwáŋ gẅie liŋé yé áa mǒ na múɔ pwó we ńnáa mbwó Hamaŋ ngàŋmbù pʉ̀a Yúndà, ńgwɔ́ míŋ Amendata nyìŋ Agag.
en: The king removed his signet ring   from his hand and gave it to Haman son of Hammedatha the Agagite, the enemy of the Jews.  # 3:10 Est 7:6; 9:10

ngiemboon: Fùɔ leen ńké ńgɔɔn mbwó Hamaŋ ngie: Mèŋ n nyě nkáb mbɔɔ pʉ̀a láʼ pɔ́ɔn né gù. Lɔg ńgÿo mmó gie ɔ̀ zsě.
en: Then the king told Haman, “The money and people are given to you to do with as you see fit.”

ngiemboon: Mé leen ńtóŋ patẅénzóŋ pe fùɔ, á gwɔ́ na lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ mbɔ́ɔntè ntsɔ̀b tá né legém na ndùŋmvfò saŋ, mé la pú ŋweʼe mbʉ̌ mie Hamaŋ zǎb, ńtúm ńnáa mbwó mengúmnɔ̀ɔn fùɔ, mbɔɔ mengúmnɔ̀ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ yɛ̌ láʼ wɔ́ɔ, mbɔɔ pasáʼ pʉ̀a tsɛ̀ɛ láʼ, mbɔɔ mbwó wɛ̌ fùɔ láʼ wɔ́ɔ, mé lɔ́ɔn ńgwaa túmo náa tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ láʼ wɔ́ɔ, ńŋweʼe pɔ́ páʼ pɔ́ ŋweʼe mmó na yɔ́b shwóŋe púʼu, ḿbiŋ ńdɔg pɔ́ shwóŋè yɛ̌ nùɔ pʉ̀a wɔ́ɔ ŋweʼe yɔ́b, ńdɔg pɔ́ lezíŋ fùɔ Zɛɛzɛ́sè ńŋweʼe mɛ̌ meŋwàʼne, ḿbiŋ ńdɔg pɔ́ liŋé yé ńjÿɔ́ʼ.
en: The royal scribes were summoned   on the thirteenth day of the first month, and the order was written exactly as Haman commanded. It was intended for the royal satraps,  # 3:12 Ezr 8:36 the governors of each of the provinces, and the officials of each ethnic group and written for each province in its own script and to each ethnic group in its own language.  # 3:12 Est 1:22; 8:9 It was written in the name of King Ahasuerus  # 3:12 1Kg 21:8 and sealed with the royal signet ring.  # 3:12 Est 8:10

ngiemboon: Memántúm zɔ̌ la lɔg meŋwàʼne ŋwɛ́ ńgʉa ńnáa tsɛ̀ɛ meláʼ mie fùɔ lɔ̌ɔn sáʼa, mé ŋweʼe tsoló ngie: mé pú ńzẅé, ḿvele pʉ̀a Yúndà pɔ́ ntsèm léfó na múɔshùm ńgʉa ńkúu na nzẅìŋe ndÿò, lâ mezwě pɔ́b mbɔɔ metsìŋendá pɔ́ na tàʼa lyɛ̌ʼ á na lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ mbɔ́ɔntè ntsɔ̀b tá né legém na mesaŋ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a, á saŋ gẅie pʉ̀a Yúndà tóŋ le Andàa. Mé lɔ́ɔn ńge túʼ shúm sɔ́b pɔ́ ntsèm.
en: Letters were sent by couriers   to each of the royal provinces telling the officials to destroy, kill, and annihilate all the Jewish people #— #young and old, women and children #— #and plunder their possessions on a single day,  # 3:13 Est 8:11–13; 9:10 the thirteenth day of Adar, the twelfth month.  # 3:13 LXX adds the text of Ahasuerus’s letter here.

ngiemboon: Aŋwàʼne ŋwɛ́ lɔ́ɔn ńgee tà ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ láʼ wɔ́ɔ ńcʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ lepʉ̌ sie mé zǎb, páʼ mé ge tóŋo mvfò láʼ, pɔ́ nyɛte membùm mɔ́b ńdɔg ńzẅíʼte yɛ̌ lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ.
en: A copy of the text, issued as law throughout every province, was distributed to all the peoples so that they might get ready for that day.

ngiemboon: Afùɔ tsẅi né memántúm pɔ́ gʉa ńdwo ńgabte meŋwàʼne ŋwɛ́ tsɛ̀ɛ meláʼ, ńgiŋe ńtóŋ lepʉ̌ sie é laa tsoló á Sẅísè gẅie à laa sẅɛ̂láʼ. Afùɔ pɔ́ Hamaŋ leen ńké ńgʉa ńnéŋe ssé ńzye lénú melùʼ, ńgwaa nú púʼu, atÿǒsoŋo Sẅísè cʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀.
en: The couriers left, spurred on by royal command, and the law was issued in the fortress of Susa.   The king and Haman sat down to drink, while the city of Susa was in confusion.  # 3:15 Est 7:1; 8:15
